Happens on the 15th of the following month of the offer. The payment for opt-in creators will be calculated as follows:\n
How to use Ads Incentive Program

If you don't meet the Minimum Hours Broadcast requirement, you will receive a prorated amount. The prorated amount is calculated based on your actual hours broadcast over the required Minimum Hours Broadcast.

If you exceed the Minimum Hours Broadcast requirement, you will receive the full amount of the incentive and your additional regular ad revenue for the extra hours that you've broadcasted during the offer month.
If you meet the Minimum Hours Broadcast requirement, you will receive the full amount of the incentive.
If you opt out of the program, you will receive a prorated incentive payout, and you will continue to be paid for any ads run at your normal payout rate.
Minimum number of hours you need to broadcast from the start date to the end date of the offer to receive full amount of the incentive.
Minutes of ads shown per hour. This changes depending on the offer Creators select.

Offers are made to creators. They include a fixed payout, a minimum number of hours broadcast, and a minimum number of ads run over a time period. Creators can choose the offer that fits their stream.

On this page, you'll see your personalized offer options as well as the auto ads scheduler. Below are definition of terms that may be new to you and we're here to help you make an informed decision on which offer to claim!
The amount of money creators can receive if they meet the requirements fully or partially.
The beginning of your offer period. During this time, Ads Manager will run the agreed-upon ad minutes each hour.
The end of your offer period. Ads Manager will stop running the agreed-upon ad minutes each hour.
A monthly opt-in program to select a new ad density requirement and earn a high ad revenue.

You have until 11:59 PM (UTC) on the day before the Offer Start Date to opt-in to the Ads Incentive Program by selecting one of the Offers presented in your Creator Dashboard and agreeing to the following terms. Beginning on the Offer Start Date and continuing until 11:59 PM (UTC) on the Offer End Date (“Incentive Period”), you agree that you will stream at least the Minimum Hours Broadcast (as such statistic is displayed on your Creator Dashboard) of audiovisual content, pursuant to the terms of your Affiliate Agreement or Partner Agreement (whichever is applicable) and the Twitch Terms of Service (including the Twitch Community Guidelines), and run the Ad Minutes specified in your selected Offer in consideration for the designated Completion Payout; you must have Ads Manager enabled and you must remain opted-in to Stream Display Ads for the duration of the Incentive Period. 

If you do not meet the Minimum Hours Broadcast during the Incentive Period, the Completion Payout designated by your selected Offer will be reduced by a pro rata amount (on a percentage basis) to be determined by your actual hours broadcast (“HB”) and actual ads inserted per HB during the Incentive Period. If you exceed the Minimum Hours Broadcast during the Incentive Period, you will receive payment pursuant to the terms of your Affiliate Agreement or Partner Agreement for any HB streamed in excess of the Minimum Hours Broadcast. 

You may opt-out of the Ads Incentive Program at any time during the Incentive Period by selecting the End Offer option in your selected Offer. If you opt-out of the Ads Incentive Program during the Incentive Period, the Completion Payout designated by your selected Offer will be reduced by a pro rata amount (on a percentage basis) to be determined by your actual HB and actual ads inserted per HB during the Incentive Period up until the date on which you opted-out. Your participation in the Ads Incentive Program will automatically expire at the close of the Incentive Period. In the event of a conflict between these terms and the terms of your Affiliate Agreement or Partner Agreement with regard to compensation relating to ad density, these terms will control.

Below, you can find the Advertisement payment rates as referred to in your Affiliate Agreement.  These rates are presented by country of user that views applicable Advertisements and may change from time to time (including changes to territory groupings).  Any changes to these rates will apply to Advertisements run after such changes.
Please review your main Affiliate Agreement for other terms applicable to any payments for Advertisements.
“Group A” territories are: Canada, the United Kingdom, and the United States.
“Group B” territories are: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Ireland, the Netherlands, Norway, Sweden, and Switzerland.
“Group C” territories are: any territory that is not included in Group A or Group B.

Try out a game or completely different content. It could be a limited event or your new favorite thing to stream!
Try running 1 minute of ads per hour. Ads may help increase your revenue, but they absolutely give you and chat a break during long streams.

<x:bold>Automatic Tags</x:bold>: Automatic Tags are automatically applied to streams when certain conditions are met. They cannot be applied directly by creators to their streams.
<x:bold>Category Tags</x:bold>: Category Tags are applied to categories, and generally describe things like game genres. They cannot be applied directly by creators to their streams.

<x:bold>Stream Tags</x:bold>: Stream Tags are generally applied by creators or their channel editors to streams (up to five at a time), but some may also only be applied to channels that meet qualifying conditions.

Tags help describe live streams and categories. Viewers can use tags to find something interesting to watch by filtering streams or categories within the directory, searching for specific tags, or when they’re browsing front page recommendations.
Twitch manages the list of available tags, but new tags are regularly added based on community feedback. If you’d like a specific tag added, you can suggest new tags here: {link}.

Video based Extensions reside on the stream, letting viewers interact with streamers directly on the video. Create interactive elements that complement the live stream, such as live stats or instant replays.

Animation showing how Ban Evasion Detection signals surface in chat.

Our system will identify potential Ban Evaders as either Possible or Likely.                       Our default recommendation applies Monitoring to messages from Possible evaders and Restricts chat from Likely Evaders,                       but channels with a more active Mod team, or less trouble with Ban Evasion, may prefer to only Monitor the Likely evaders.                       To view a demo of Ban Evasion Detection, click <x:link>here</x:link>.
Successfully turned on Ban Evasion Detection
When enabled, potential ban evaders will be detected and flagged for moderators to review.
Ban Evasion Detection uses machine learning to detect potential ban evaders using a signal level you select. When enabled, users will be flagged and surfaced to moderators for review.
Messages from suspected Ban Evaders will be delivered to all chatters and will not be flagged to Moderators
Successfully turned off Ban Evasion Detection
Successfully updated Ban Evasion Detection settings
All Possible Evaders will be flagged for Monitoring. Their messages will still be delivered to all chatters.
Likely Evaders will be Restricted. Their messages will be delivered only to Mods.
Our recommended settings apply Monitoring to Possible Ban Evaders and Restrict Likely Ban Evaders from sending messages to Chat

source: When you use Bits in a channel, Twitch rewards the streamer and you create an exciting moment.
Celebrate big moments and support your favorite streamers with special animated emotes!
Bits can be purchased via major credit cards, Amazon Payments, PayPal, and a wide variety of global payment methods. We are actively working to add more local payment methods and currencies.

Cheering makes Twitch chat more engaging for the entire community. Cheering elevates your voice in Chat with animated emotes, and expresses your enthusiasm in the moment through interactive leaderboards and extensions. Also, Twitch rewards streamers for Cheers in a channel typically at the rate of 1 cent per Bit. In some special cases, like esports tournaments or charity events, there may be different revenue sharing arrangements.

Cheering makes Twitch chat more engaging for the entire community. Cheering elevates your voice in Chat with animated emotes, and expresses your enthusiasm through interactive leaderboards and extensions. Also, Twitch rewards streamers for Cheers in a channel typically at the rate of 1 cent per Bit. In some special cases, like esports tournaments or charity events, there may be different revenue sharing arrangements.

Cheermotes include animated versions of popular global emotes, or custom animated emotes in Partner channels, that you can unlock using Bits. The more Bits you use, the cooler the animations you can choose from. You can see all the Cheermotes available in any channel by clicking the Bits icon at the bottom of chat to preview them before using Bits.
Click the Bits icon in the Chat box, select the Cheermote you want to use in your Cheer, then select the amount.
For more details on how to buy Bits, visit our <x:link>help page</x:link>.
Go through the checkout flow to have Bits ready to celebrate big stream moments as they happen.
Have questions that weren't answered here?
Here are two ways you can Cheer:
How exactly does Cheering support streamers?
On web and mobile, you can purchase Bits in Chat by clicking the Bits icon here:
On web, you can also click the “Get Bits” button in the upper-right corner of the screen near the crown and bell icons.
Right here! Simply select your quantity on the right side of this page.
Support Streamers by Cheering with Bits!

The more Bits you Cheer with, the more expressive the Cheermote animation, and the more Badges you’ll unlock. You can even be recognized as a supporter on a Top Cheerer leaderboard in channels where the streamer has turned the leaderboard on.
Type “Cheer” in chat followed by the amount of Bits you want to use. For example, “cheer100” will Cheer 100 Bits.
Visit our <x:link>Help page</x:link> for more details on Cheering.

When you Cheer, select from Cheermotes that include Bits gems and animated versions of popular global emotes, or choose from custom emotes in some Partner channels.
You can also include a message and then hit Enter or click “Chat” to send your Cheer.

Bits are purchased via Amazon Payments and PayPal.
Cheer with Bits to celebrate and show support!

Cheering makes Twitch chat more engaging for everyone. It shows streamers who their most enthusiastic fans are, and makes it easy to thank them with overlays and shoutouts. In addition, Twitch provides participating streamers a share of the revenue Twitch receives from Bits used to Cheer for them. The standard share for Partners and Affiliates is 1 cent per Bit used to Cheer for them. In some special cases, like esports tournaments or charity events, there may be different revenue sharing arrangements.

Cheermotes are animated versions of popular global emotes, or custom animated emotes in Partner channels, that use Bits. The more Bits used, the cooler the animation. You can see all the Cheermotes available in any channel by clicking the Bit icon at the bottom of chat.
Here are some examples. There are many more to choose from!
Learn how to buy Bits on Twitch and support your favorite Twitch partners and affiliates.
Once you have purchased Bits, and you are in the chat entry window on a channel page, type \cheer\" and the number of Bits you want to use. Or click the Bit gem icon at the bottom right of chat

<x:bold>No needless bad-mouthing.</x:bold> You can share your authentic opinion of the content, even if it’s not entirely positive. However, be mindful of the difference between constructive feedback, which is welcome, and mean-spirited bashing, which is not.

<x:bold>Payouts are based on concurrent viewer requirements being met.</x:bold> You’ll get a payout for hitting the minimum viewer requirements provided in the bounty. If you achieve the minimum but don't reach the average viewer goal, you’ll get a percentage of the maximum payout.

<x:bold>Use the Bounties Widget on your</x:bold> <x:link>Live Dashboard</x:link> <x:bold>to track your bounty.</x:bold> It automatically sets your Game/Category and updates your stream title to include <x:bold>{hashTag}</x:bold>, both of which must be properly set and in place to consider a bounty as complete.

<x:bold>Use the Manage Bounties Quick Action on your</x:bold> <x:link>Stream Manager</x:link> <x:bold>page to track your bounty.</x:bold> It automatically sets your Game/Category and updates your stream title to include <x:bold>{hashTag}</x:bold>, both of which must be properly set and in place to consider a bounty as complete. To add the Quick Action, go to your <x:link>Stream Manager</x:link> page, click on the plus button in the Quick Actions panel, and then enable Manage Bounties under the Monetize Your Stream section.

<x:bold>We require you to disclose your bounties to viewers.</x:bold> In addition to including <x:bold>{hashTag}</x:bold> in your stream title, make sure that your viewers are aware that your bounties are sponsored content.
<x:bold>We’ll use Past Broadcasts to verify bounty completion.</x:bold> Make sure to have \Store Past Broadcasts\" on in your <x:link>Channel Settings</x:link>. Otherwise
destination: you won't get paid."

source: Bounty Board allows you to browse and accept sponsored opportunities (AKA bounties) from brands. Before you activate a bounty, here are a couple important things to keep in mind:
Please make sure you review the terms associated with your bounty for additional details.

<x:bold>Had a notification but no new Bounties?</x:bold> Bounties generally launch at 4PM EST (GMT -4 / GMT -5), and can be fully claimed extremely quickly. Be sure to check this page then to claim bounties before other streamers!
You currently have no activated bounties in queue. Once activated, bounties are held in your queue for a maximum of 5 days. They will expire sooner if the broader bounty campaign is ending.
Failed to load channel properties. Please refresh the page and try again.
You must be streaming in order to run a bounty.
You must turn on <x:link>Store past broadcasts</x:link> in order to run a bounty.
Your bounty could not be marked as complete. Our system indicates some requirements were not met. If you have questions or think this was a mistake, <x:link>contact us</x:link>.
During the Bounty, the following notification will be displayed in <x:bold>your audience's chat every {frequency}</x:bold>:
* this platform is region locked, please enter your region
Bounty Board is currently invite only!
Hang tight, we will let you know once your profile is set up. If you still haven't completed the required survey, please click <x:link>here</x:link>.
Over the next few weeks we'll be picking more broadcasters to join in on the fun. Just complete a survey to get added to the list!
Your bounty has been flagged as violating the Bounty Board Terms & Conditions. If you have questions about this decision, please contact <x:link>bountyboard@twitch.tv</x:link>.
Based on your concurrent viewers, you got a payout of <x:bold>${payout}</x:bold> out of a potential ${maxPayout}. Bounty payouts are bundled with your standard monthly accrued revenue payment.
Based on your concurrent viewers, you got the max payout of <x:bold>${maxPayout}</x:bold>. Bounty payouts are bundled with your standard monthly accrued revenue payment.

Unfortunately your average concurrent viewers did not reach the minimum requirement of <x:bold>{ccuMin} concurrent viewers</x:bold> and you will not receive a payout for this bounty. Make sure to do bounties during your peak hours to increase your chances of a good payout.
You hit <x:bold>{percentPayout}%</x:bold> of your target payout goal, for a total of <x:bold>${payout}</x:bold>. Bounty payouts are bundled with your standard monthly accrued revenue payment.
If you already own the game and don't need the key, feel free to give it to a member of your community.
It will expire sooner if the broader bounty campaign is ending.

A full suite for all your streaming needs: Bot, Overlays, Loyalty points, Giveaways and much more for new and veteran streamers alike.

Create professional live streams from your browser in seconds. Invite guests, customize your broadcast, add your branding, and grow your viewership. Intuitive and bundled with powerful features. No downloads required.
For more info, visit the <x:link>Support Center</x:link>.
Free and open source software for recording and live streaming. Source code is available to everyone to contribute and improve.

Gamecaster is a free live streaming and recording software built with gamers in mind. The onboarding tutorial will set you up with professional scenes and the best settings in just a couple of clicks. Its intuitive interface and features such as the In-Game Overlay make it the perfect solution for gamers looking to start streaming with minimal setup and equipment.
Here are the most common tools for broadcasting.
Looking for your stream key? You can find it on your <x:link>dashboard</x:link>.
Muxy provides alerts, tips, a real-time Live Feed, Cheer visualizations, and stream analytics.

OBS.Live is StreamElements' OBS Studio free add-on for streaming (supports V23). OBS.Live makes stream management easy, integrating Twitch chat, your Activity Feed, and Media Request directly into OBS. Other features include Custom Bot name, HotKeys and Leaderboards.

OWN3D Pro is an all-in-one solution plugin for OBS Studio with more than 300+ overlays, 300+ alerts, chatbot, copyright-free music and more. Surprise your viewers with animated designs to match your current mood, your game or the holidays.
Opera Event is a platform for arming broadcasters with the ability to engage, grow, enhance and monetize their audience.
Professional live streaming from your browser. Build your ideal layout. Bring on guests remotely. Advanced creative possibilities made easy for anyone.

Soundtrack is a music tool built specifically for Twitch creators like you. Soundtrack is for your live streams, music from Soundtrack is separated into its own audio channel and will not be saved to your VODs and clips. Stream worry free with our curated library of rights-cleared playlists and stations.

Streamlabs Desktop is a free, open-source, all-in-one streaming software for new streamers and power users alike. Everything you need to live stream is available in one solution: built-in widgets & chat, game-optimized settings, selective recording, 50 unique apps, and thousands of overlays and themes.

Streamlabs is home to a comprehensive suite of live streaming tools and features to help streamers grow their audience and make a living creating content. Streamlabs offers tools like alerts, tips, chatbot, merch, logo maker, twitch panel maker, a charity platform, and dozens of interactive widgets.
XSplit is a free, highly customizable, and powerful suite of applications to broadcast to Twitch. Whether creating a live stream or editing/uploading clips, it is easy to get started.

Thank you for submitting your onboarding information, and welcome to the Affiliate Program!
The Streamer Community Survey is only available to Affiliates and Partners who are 18 years of age or older in your area.
The information you share in this survey will not be shared publicly and we have implemented strict security protocols to protect and secure your data.
The survey is short and should only take a few minutes to complete. Click the button below to take the survey.
This will disable responses from being entered, and will delete any previously-entered responses.
To submit this survey, please select at least one data preference and provide an answer to every question.
We are inviting Twitch Partners and Affiliates around the world to complete the Streamer Community Survey and help us build a more inclusive Twitch.

We are inviting you, and Affiliates and Partners around the world, to help us build a more inclusive Twitch by completing the Streamer Community Survey. With the information collected in the survey, we can measure and study the behaviors and interactions of different communities at scale, to ensure our products and programs promote a safe and equitable experience for creators worldwide.

We strive to provide inclusive representation in the Streamer Community Survey, and with your help, we can learn and make improvements over time. Every question includes the option to provide an open-ended response–if your identity is not represented in the list, let us know.

We will only use your data for the purposes to which you consent. As part of the Streamer Community Survey, you decide how your data is used and you can always edit that decision in the future, should you change your mind.

We're committed to making Twitch a more inclusive home for creators and their communities around the world. This starts by understanding who our creators are and how their experience on Twitch may vary based on different aspects of their identity.
Welcome to the Streamer Community Survey!

With the information collected in the Streamer Community Survey, we can measure and study the behaviors and interactions of different communities at scale, to ensure our products and programs promote a safe and equitable experience for creators worldwide.

Bit Emote means the individual Bit Emotes that appear in chat. For example, if you choose 100, viewers cannot send “Cheer150 Cheer90” because Cheer90 is less than 100. “Cheer150 Cheer150” would be acceptable, because both cheers are greater than 100.

For example, if you choose 30, viewers will not be able to send a Cheer message with 29 or fewer Bits. They will need to use at least 30 Bits, either in a single emote, or by combining emotes that add up to at least 30 Bits.
Minimum Bit to Cheer must be greater than or equal to Minimum Bit Emote
Minimum Bits Emote must be less than Minimum Bit to Cheer
Set the minimum number of Bits needed to send a Cheer message in your channel. We only recommend setting this above 1 to combat spam in chat.
Set the smallest Bit Emote that can be used in your channel. We only recommend setting this above 1 to combat spam in chat.

Twitch complies with the DMCA and similar laws worldwide. Twitch does not give any personal information about you to anyone for money. We do, however, work with trusted third-party advertising partners to personalize ads and analytics based on online identifiers and inferred interests. Under the California Consumer Privacy Act, some of this personalized advertising and analytics activity may be considered a “Sale” of data.

Twitch respects your privacy. Impression tags are a set of code (typically 1x1 image pixels) that track each time a user loads a web page. Tags are provided by a third party ad server such as DCM or Sizmek and must be fully SSL compliant. Please note, there may be some slight discrepancies in metrics reported on your dashboard due to ad block users. The use of impression tags is completely optional for Bounty Board.

Bounty Board will charge you for unique viewers (at the channel level) who stay on the stream for at least 2 minutes. If a viewer stays on the channel for less than 2 minutes, you will not be charged. Viewers who stay for 2 minutes usually watch about 20 minutes out of a one hour stream.

Bounty Board will charge you for unique viewers (at the channel level) who stay on the stream for at least 30 seconds. If a viewer stays on the channel for less than 30 seconds, you will not be charged

source: Will receive the result of all client authorizations: either an access token or a failure message. This must exactly match the redirect_uri parameter passed to the authorization endpoint. When testing locally, you can set this to the http://localhost. A maximum of 10 redirect URLs is supported.
Use this pane to manage Twitch API access to your extension.
Error loading data. Please try again later.

<x:underline>NOTE</x:underline>: Due to requirements communicated to us by Apple, Extensions support on iOS devices (including the ability to test on iOS) is restricted to Apple Developer Program members. If you develop a mobile Extension for iOS, please make sure you have an Apple developer account, and then fill out <x:link>this form</x:link> to request iOS support.
A ratio (width : height) which determines the extension's width, and how the extension's iframe will resize in different video player environments
Base width of the extension to be used when calculating how much to zoom when applying autoscale.
Define a number in the range from 100-500px. Optional - Default is 300 px

HTML file shown to broadcasters while they are configuring your extension, within the Extension Manager. The page is displayed in an iframe with dynamic width and a fixed height(700px).This should be a path relative to testing_base_uri. It should be used for infrequent, install-time configuration.
HTML file that wil be shown to viewers on the channel page when the extension is activated in a Panel slot. This should be a path relative to the testing_base_url.

HTML file that will be shown to streamers in the Live module of the Dashboard. It is used for streamer actions taken while the extension is active (e.g, creating a new poll). It should be a path relative to testing_base_uri.
HTML file that will be shown to viewers on mobile devices. This page is presented to viewers as a panel behind the chat area of the mobile app. This should be a path relative to testing_base_uri.
HTML file that will be shown to viewers on the channel page when the extension is activated in a Video - Component slot. This should be a path relative to the testing_base_url.
If autoscale is false, then the inner dimensions of the extension iframe are variable, meaning your extension must implement responsiveness.

If autoscale is true, then a CSS zoom is applied such that the size of the extension is variable but the inner dimensions are fixed based on Scale Pixels.  This allows your extension to render as if it is fixed width and height.
Note: If autoscale is false, this value is disregarded
Restriction: Values must be nonzero integers

Root URI for all assets related to this extension version, referenced for extensions  in local test only. For example, http://localhost:12345/twitch_extension/3.4.1/.  The URI must end with a forward slash (/). The URI is completely up to you; it need not match  the version in any way. During local test, the assets are served directly from this URI, so  you can update your code without re-submitting the extension version.
Specifies height relative to the maximum height of a video component extension.
This section determines where your assets will be hosted for the different stages of the process. <x:link>Learn more</x:link>

Billing managers are administrators appointed by the organization to manage Extensions accounting. Twitch will send any earned revenue for this Extension to the account specified by the user above.
Only the organization Owner can assign a billing manager. Users can be given the Billing Manager role on the <x:link>Organization Management</x:link> page.

Only the organization owner, administrators or users with the Billing Manager role can be assigned as extension billing managers. Users must have enabled 2FA and completed Extension Monetization Onboarding (via the Extensions monetization tab within the personal console).
Use this page to manage settings to use the Twitch and Extensions APIs. <x:learn>Learn more</x:learn>
Comma separated list of URLs that your extension's configuration page is allowed to open
Comma separated list of URLs that your extension's viewer page is allowed to open

Comma-separated list of base URLs from which your Extension can load additional media (i.e. <audio>, <video>, and <track> HTML elements). These values will be used by the HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) media-src directive.
Comma-separated list of base URLs from which your Extension can load images (e.g. HTML elements and favicons). These values will be used by the HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) img-src directive.

Comma-separated list of base URLs from which your Extension can load information via scripting interfaces (e.g. API calls, fetch(), XMLHttpRequest, WebSockets). These values will be used by the HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) connect-src directive.
If checked, your extension will allow viewers to provide their Twitch IDs in addition to the opaque IDs in the JWT.  For details see <x:link>Opaque IDS</x:link> in the Extension Integration Guide.

source: Congratulations! We've started your Extension. Here's what we know so far:
Email addresses must be the form of username@domain.tld only.
Must be in the format x.x.x and contain no other characters besides numbers.

Please tell us more about your Extension.  Add version number, type of Extension you want to create, a brief summary of what your Extension does, a full description, as well as your contact information.  All additional information will be auto-generated by our system.  You can manage the Extension in the Versions section at any time.
Sorry, there was an error in submitting the fields on this page. Please double check the fields below and then try saving changes again.

The Description is viewable by streamers and viewers only on the Extension Details page. It should be the full details about the functions of your Extension. This is your chance to tell them why they should activate your Extension.
The Summary is viewable by streamers and viewers throughout Twitch.  It should be one to two brief sentences describing what your Extension does. To provide more detail, use the Description field.
The Viewer Summary helps viewers understand what your extension does, and how they can interact with it when it's activated on a stream.
The following details can be filled in at a later time in the Extension manager.
This email will be used only for conversations between you and Twitch, such as to provide you with developer support.  Twitch will never reveal this email to customers or third parties.
This provides your Extension access to the Twitch API.
Version numbers must be in the format of #.#.# only.
You have exceeded the maximum number of characters allowed for this field.
You must select at least one anchor type to support for this Extension (mobile support can only be enabled in conjunction with another anchor)
You need to choose your Extension type and provide a version number before continuing.
Your support email will be displayed publicly on the Extensions directory so Twitch users can provide you feedback or ask you questions about your Extension.

source: I have read and reviewed the <x:reviewguidelines>Extension Review Guidelines</x:reviewguidelines>, <x:devagreement>Developer Services Agreement</x:devagreement> and <x:communityguidelines>Community Guidelines</x:communityguidelines>.
Please provide the URL path of the channel you want used for the review process.

Reviews may take up to 72 hours to complete. Please note: while it is required to provide a review channel link, Panel only Extensions and Extensions that do not require an external app are not required to have a review channel streaming live at the time of review. If your Extension requires a specific game environment or back-end service to be live for the functionality to be tested, please provide your availability for review times within 9AM - 5PM PT in the Walkthrough Guide and Change Log. Our review team will reach out and request another review time if we find that your review channel is not live at the time of the review.

source: <x:strong>Are you sure you'd like to delete your Twitch account? This will permanently erase all your content and profile information, and you will no longer be able to claim {login} as your username.</x:strong> <x:margin>Once you've chosen to delete your account, it will be deactivated and your channel page will no longer be accessible. Within 90 days of your request, Twitch will permanently erase all your content and close your account. The deletion process will terminate if you log back into your account while we still are processing your deletion request.</x:margin> <x:break>In some cases, Twitch may retain limited personal data for legal, security and other reasons permitted or required under applicable law. For more information, please refer to our <x:pp>Privacy Notice</x:pp>.</x:break>

For example, we use these types of cookies to:
Gather data (restricted to Twitch) through Twitch-owned cookies in order to improve Twitch’s content, products, and services and to measure and understand the performance of our services
Keep track of your preferences such as privacy choices, language, theme settings and player settings
Match and combine offline data sources
Operational cookies are used to provide our services and cannot be disabled.
Please visit <x:cookie-notice>Twitch’s Cookie Notice</x:cookie-notice> for guidance on how to modify your cookie choices in the future.
Present relevant content, providing other customized features and services
Prevent fraudulent activity and improve security
Receive and use automatically-sent device characteristics for identification
Recognize you when you sign in to use our services
Store and/or access information on a device

Third-party developers of Twitch Extensions may use Google Analytics cookies to analyze usage of their extensions. Withholding consent will disable Google Analytics cookies for all Extensions that you have enabled, which could limit a developer’s ability to improve its Extension(s).

Twitch uses cookies to personalize, measure, and deliver advertising and marketing messages. To learn more about how Twitch provides interest-based ads, please visit the <x:link>Twitch Ad Choices</x:link> page. Third parties may use cookies in the process of delivering and measuring content, including ads, relevant to your interests on Twitch and third-party sites.

We also use third-party payment processors to collect and process payments in connection with the commerce offerings available on the Twitch Services. These payment processors share details of their data collection practices with you separately as part of their respective payment check-out process.

We use cookies and similar tools (collectively, “cookies”) for the purposes described below and will apply your cookie preferences on this device. You might be asked to provide your consent again if you use another device.

When you do not accept a third party below, they will not be permitted to place a new cookie on your device, or access/update an existing cookie, beyond one that remembers your privacy choice to withhold consent.

While most operational cookies are owned and managed by Twitch, in limited cases, we work with trusted third parties who use cookies to enable their services - refer to our <x:link>Cookie Notice</x:link> for additional detail.

Some third parties participate in the Interactive Advertising Bureau’s Transparency & Consent Framework (<x:link>IAB TCF</x:link>) which enables users to consent to cookies and data processing purposes through the IAB TCF standard

ASMR stands for autonomous sensory meridian response, and these channels and videos seek to trigger that particular feeling in viewers or listeners.
ATLAS is a survival MMO from Studio Wildcard
Apex Legends is a battle royale game based in the Titanfall universe
Arma 3 is the third core game in the simulation and modern combat Arma franchise.
Artifact is a trading card game by Valve and Richard Garfield, creator of Magic the Gathering, set in the Dota universe.
Auto Chess is the stand-alone adaptation of the autobattler Dota 2 mod \Dota Auto Chess\" from the original developers"
Battlefield V sees the series return to a World War II setting for the first time in nearly a decade.
Black Ops is back! Featuring gritty, grounded, fluid Multiplayer combat, the biggest Zombies offering ever and Blackout, an intense battle royale experience.
CS:GO is the fourth iteration of Valve's team-based modern-military first-person shooter
Dark Souls III melds elements from all previous Souls games and concludes the Dark Souls trilogy.
Dead by Daylight features four survivors that try to escape haunted locales as a serial murderer hunts them.
Destiny 2 is a sci-fi open-world first-person shooter developed by Bungie.
Dota 2 is the official free-to-play sequel to the Warcraft III custom scenario that originally popularized the Multiplayer Online Battle Arena sub-genre.
EA Sports' soccer franchise returns for the 2018 season.
Escape from Tarkov, a hardcore first-person shooter, takes place in a fictional Russian city torn apart by rival private military companies.
Fortnite is a sandbox-survival third-person shooter from the studio behind the Unreal Tournament and Gears of War series.
Grand Theft Auto V is a modern crime epic featuring a crew of three protagonists rolling through the fictional state of San Andreas.
Guild Wars 2 is an online RPG developed by ArenaNet.
Hearthstone is a free-to-play collectible card game by Blizzard Entertainment set in the Warcraft universe.
Heroes from Warcraft, StarCraft, Diablo, Overwatch, and other universes are summoned to the Nexus for five-on-five combat.
Hyper Scape is an urban futuristic free-to-play Battle Royale, with a cutting edge Twitch extension integration for streamers and viewers.
League of Legends is a free-to-play competitive MOBA game with a large following in Esports.
MTG Arena is a digital collectible card game by Wizards of the Coast.
Mortal Kombat's eleventh installment involves the time guardian Kronika intending to fix Raiden's mistakes which splintered the timeline
Overwatch is a stylish sci-fi, team-based, first-person shooter from Blizzard.
PLAYERUNKNOWN’S BATTLEGROUNDS is a battle royale shooter that pits 100 players against each other in a struggle for survival.
Path of Exile is a free-to-play PC online action Role-Playing Game set in a dark fantasy world.
Poker is a card game that uses the traditional 52 playing card deck.
ROBLOX is a free Massive Multiplayer Online Game, where you play in user-created worlds with blocks and physics.
Rainbow Six: Siege is a competitive multiplayer first-person shooter developed by Ubisoft Montreal.
RimWorld is a colony-building game about a crash-landed space crew and their fight for survival.
Rust, from the makers of Garry's Mod, Rust is a multiplayer survival game with combat elements.
Sea of Thieves is a first-person open-world game where players form a crew of pirates and sail off to find treasure.
Summoners War is a mobile RPG for Android and iOS with a ladder that resets weekly.
The 2018 release from 2k's basketball simulation franchise.
The Switch debut of Nintendo's flagship fighting game series brings together every character from the series' history.
The fifth numbered entry in the renowned Street Fighter series of fighting games.
The first 3D Legend of Zelda game, Ocarina of Time was created for the Nintendo 64 in 1998.
The second in the Super Smash Bros. series brought the four-player brawling action to the GameCube in 2001.
Tibia is an MMORPG created in 1997 by developer CipSoft GmbH.
Twitch Sings is a dynamic, endlessly watchable livestreaming vocal performance platform.
World of Tanks is a free-to-play, team-based action game featuring WWII-era tank combat.
World of Warcraft is an MMORPG that takes place in Blizzard Entertainment's Warcraft universe

A Hype Train starts when multiple people subscribe, use Bits, or gift subscriptions to the community.
Once a Hype Train is underway, the community fills up the Hype Meter with more subs, gifts or Bits. Everyone who contributes receives one unique emote based on the highest level completed.

Hype Trains should feel special. To keep them exciting, set a cooldown period to provide time between when the community can trigger Hype Trains.

Select the difficulty for your hype goals. Higher difficulty settings require more support to complete.           Make sure the difficulty encourages viewers to push the train to the next level without meeting a swift defeat.

Bits are available for use immediately after payment. You have the right to cancel your purchase and obtain a refund within seven days from the date of the purchase, provided that you have not used any of the Bits purchased in this transaction, at which point Twitch will deduct the purchased Bits from your account. Your purchase cannot be cancelled, irrespective of the date of the purchase, if you have used any of the Bits purchased in this transaction.

By clicking Complete Purchase, you agree to the <x:use>Twitch Bits Acceptable Use Policy</x:use>, <x:tos>Terms of Sale</x:tos>, and <x:privacy>Privacy Policy</x:privacy> and that we may start to deliver this order. Multiplayer Ads are a new way for communities to experience ad breaks. When a Multiplayer Ad is triggered, viewers in the channel watch the same ad, and then are presented a poll afterward. Voting in the poll helps support you, the streamer, via Bits!

Omlet Arcade is the premier platform for powering up your gaming experience. Live stream your best moments, squad up with new friends, and use custom tools to improve your gameplay. All mobile games are supported, including PUBG Mobile, Fortnite, Minecraft, Brawl Stars, Roblox, and more!

Stream mobile games or your camera from your mobile device with free streaming tools built from the ground up in our mobile app. Streaming from the Twitch app is the easiest way to start streaming to Twitch, no setup required.

The Streamlabs mobile app is the easiest way to broadcast your mobile games, or stream yourself IRL. Customize your layout, add professional overlay themes and alerts, and go live with ease, all from your phone.

To keep an audience and keep it growing you should always be on the lookout for new ways to engage with them. One way to do that is by installing Extensions on your channel. You can think of extensions as apps for your streams that give your community more ways to interact with you, each other, or what you're streaming.

All of these are general guidelines, and exceptions are handled on a case-by-case basis.

Complete the <x:path-to-partner>Path to Partner Achievement</x:path-to-partner> or demonstrate large, engaged viewership/following on other services. Streamers who complete the Path to Partner achievements in your Achievements Dashboard will unlock a button to apply for Partnership, and receive priority for their application to be reviewed. Please note that these Achievements list the minimum criteria we look for in potential Partners, and completing them does not guarantee Partnership.
Content that conforms to our <x:guidelines>Community Guidelines</x:guidelines>, <x:tos>Terms of Service</x:tos> and <x:dmca>DMCA Guidelines</x:dmca>.

If you do not currently meet these qualifications, you should consider the <x:affiliate-program>Affiliate program</x:affiliate-program>, obtainable through the <x:path-to-affiliate>Path to Affiliate Achievement</x:path-to-affiliate>. You can also learn more about how to grow on Twitch via <x:creator-camp>Creator Camp</x:creator-camp>, the go-to strategy guide for all things Twitch.

Make sure you tell us a little bit about your channel and community as well as any other achievements that you think are relevant to your Partnership application. You can also include your social media accounts to help us evaluate your application.

Since we take the time to review every application individually, it may take up to 2-4 weeks for you to hear back from us. Those who have completed the Path to Partner Achievement can expect a response within 7 business days.

The Twitch Partnership Program is for those who are committed to streaming. Twitch Partners are creators who stream a variety of content, from games, music, talk shows, art, to just about anything else you can imagine. If you love sharing what you do with a live audience and have built up a sizeable, engaged community on Twitch or other services, we want to hear from you!

However, you will not receive future content without an active Twitch Prime membership.

You will only receive content that is currently available. However, if you have successfully claimed the first Twitch Prime pack but not completed the account linking flow prior to May 9, 2018 at 9 AM PST, you will receive that content after completing the current offer claim flow above.
You'll have until July 11, 2018 at 9 AM PST to claim the Twitch Prime Pack #2.

AMD video card users, this one's for you! Twitch Studio now supports AMD hardware encoding to maximize your stream quality without sacrificing performance. Add a chat box as a layer to any scene and chat messages will appear directly on your screen during a stream. To try it out, while you're in edit mode for a scene, hit the + sign next to \Layers\" and select \"Chat Box\"."
Adding new scenes just got a facelift

Are you ready to get to the next level? Whether you're aiming to get your first couple of followers or ready to work towards Affiliate status, Creator Goals is a powerful new way for you to set specific objectives on Twitch to help you grow. With Creator Goals, you can easily share real-time progress with your community of how their support gets you closer to your goals. To get started with follower or subscriber goals on your channel, just add a \Goal\" layer by entering edit mode on a scene and clicking \"Add Layer\"."
AutoMod Queue - If your channel has AutoMod enabled, any messages held by AutoMod for review will appear here
Boost your efficiency with linked layers
Build your community with Creator Goals
Complex audio setup? We’ve got you covered!

Customize your workflow with different Quick Actions that help you seamlessly perform the tasks that matter most when you’re live, such as creating Clips, clearing your Chat history, raiding a channel, and more. To get started with Quick Actions, click the lock icon {lock} in the top left corner of the app, then hover your cursor over the “+” sign at the right side of the app to open the “Edit Studio Layout” menu.
Easily keep track of your Chat and Activity Feed with the in-game overlay!
Fine-tune your stream’s audio with the Advanced Audio Mixer!

Hype up your fans for your stream's start with a countdown timer layer. It's also pretty clutch for speedrunning, counting down to an announcement, and of course, AFK breaks. To add a timer, while you're in edit mode for a scene, hit the + sign next to \Layers\" and select \"Countdown\"."

It’s now easier than ever to stream with a single monitor. Keep an eye on your chat messages, alerts, and even your stream status and view count, without losing focus on your game. With the new in-game overlay, you can interact with your viewers and respond to messages without having to look at your phone or other device. To enable the overlay, go to your Settings, select the “In-Game Overlay” tab and click the toggle for “Enable In-Game Overlay”.
New Panels Available in Twitch Studio!
New for You in Twitch Studio

Now you can copy, paste, and duplicate layers or even entire scenes to save time when creating new scenes. Easily duplicate a scene by right-clicking on the scene name and selecting “Duplicate”. Copy and paste layers via the right-click menu, with keybinds, or through the buttons along the top of your screen while you're in edit mode.

Twitch Studio’s pre-built customizable scene templates are now easily accessible every time you add a new scene. With scenes designed for showing off your gameplay, or to build up anticipation when you’re ready to go live (with the new \Starting Soon\" scene template)

source: Unban Requests - View and manage unban requests from banned chatters here

Want to add your personal take to a co-stream? Looking for an easier way to point things out to your viewers while playing a game? With the new Draw Mode feature, you can do all that and more, simply by using the brush tool to draw directly over your stream. Tap into your creative side by customizing the size and color of the brush or incorporating different shapes. To get started, click on the {telestratorIcon} icon at the top right of your \Stream Preview\" panel to enable Draw Mode."

We’ve heard from creators that they want more ways to control the audio that they include on stream. With the new Advanced Audio Mixer, you can adjust the audio from specific programs (such as Discord or Soundtrack by Twitch) right inside Twitch Studio without needing complex virtual audio cables or expensive hardware. In addition, with the Advanced Audio Mixer you can exclude specific audio sources from your VODs and Clips so that they sound exactly the way you want. To install the Advanced Audio Mixer, click the {cogwheel} at the bottom right of the app to go to “Settings”, select the “Audio” tab, and click the “Install” button next to “Advanced Audio Mixer”.

We’ve heard from creators that they want more ways to control the audio that they include on stream. With the new Advanced Audio Mixer, you can adjust the audio from specific programs (such as Discord) right inside Twitch Studio without needing complex virtual audio cables or expensive hardware. In addition, with the Advanced Audio Mixer you can exclude specific audio sources from your VODs and Clips so that they sound exactly the way you want. To get started, go to the audio mixer in the bottom left of the app and click \Add Audio\" to add an audio source."

With NDI plugin support, Twitch Studio will automatically detect if an NDI source is available, and allows you to add the source as a layer. This makes capturing gameplay on one machine and streaming to another seamless, and easily allows you to utilize Twitch Studio for your streams if you prefer using a dual-PC setup.

destination: you can easily import multiple high quality scenes that use the .overlay file format. If you have purchased any premium scene overlays or want to import a .overlay that you already have
column3: click on the {settingsIcon} icon in the bottom right and then click on \"Import Scenes\". If you select a .overlay file and click \"Import File\" your scenes should begin importing. Keep in mind that not every layer type is supported
column4: so double check your scenes to make sure they are good to go before going live."

source: You can now choose from 35 free transition styles (including Dissolve, Fade, and Wipe) to level up your stream's production quality and make your transitions between scenes silky smooth. Tap on your profile icon and go to Settings, then Transitions, to give them a try.

You can now customize how Twitch Studio looks by adding, moving, resizing, and removing panels. Hit the lock icon at the top left and try it out! As part of this new feature, we've also updated \layouts\" to be called \"scenes\" — but the way they work remains the same"
You can now customize your audio setup with multiple input and output sources for your stream. <x:link>Questions? Join Our Discord</x:link>

You can now link any layer of the same type across different scenes, so it’s a snap to make edits across all of your linked layers at once. Linking multiple layers uses the same resources as only one layer, allowing you to maintain a high quality stream without sacrificing performance. Linked layers share all properties except for position. To get started, select the layer you wish to link in the \Layers\" list and click the {linkIcon} icon to \"Link Layer\"."

A <x:strong>noise gate</x:strong> keeps your microphone from picking up random sounds like keyboard clacks that are quieter than your speaking voice.
A <x:strong>noise suppressor</x:strong> reduces constant background sounds like noise from a fan or fridge.
Loudness equalization uses an <x:strong>audio compressor</x:strong> to make sure your microphone doesn't get too loud if you scream.
You can fine-tune each of these in the App Settings after setup

Welcome to Twitch Studio Beta, our free streaming software designed for new streamers to create content and share it with a community.

Whether you’re using your computer’s built-in mic and camera or a more complex set up, our step-by-step onboarding, automatic hardware detection, and recommended settings will help your stream look and sound great with minimal effort. Our built-in desktop audio capture capability also lets you easily share audio from your web browser or computer directly to your stream, no extra configuration required.
With Twitch Studio, everything you need to create a community is at your fingertips, no extra plug-ins required. Alerts, activity feed, and Twitch chat are all built-in.

Our free streaming software is built from the ground up for new streamers looking for a simple setup process and high quality stream. With guided setup, built-in integration to Twitch, and plenty of customization options, Twitch Studio makes it easier than ever to get started and manage your Twitch channel.

People come to Twitch to see YOU. Try to be yourself, have fun and enjoy the process.
Post when you’re going live, talk to your community when you’re AFK, and share memorable clips.

Use Social Media to Grow Your Audience
Viewers who chat in their first visit are 50% more likely to return to your channel. Encourage chatting by asking questions, responding to chatters and welcoming new viewers.
What’s most important is streaming something that you’re passionate about or that you can’t resist sharing with the world.
When you stream, ask your viewers to make clips of their favorite moments. You can share those clips on social media to show off your best content.
